sen.j: 真言宗泉涌寺派（しんごんしゅうせんにゅうじは）は、日本における真言系仏教宗派のひとつで、古義真言宗に属する。
sen.e: Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school is one of the Shingon line Buddhist schools and belongs to Kogi Shingon school (Old Shingon school.)
Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school is one of the Shingon line Buddhist schools that belongs to the Kogi Shingon school (Old Shingon school.)
Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school is one of the Shingon line Buddhist schools that belongs to the Kogi Shingon school (Old Shingon school).
Sohonzan (the general head temple of a Buddhist sect) is Sennyu-ji Temple.
Sohonzan (the general head temple of a Buddhist sect) is Sennyu-ji Temple.
Sohonzan (the general head temple of a Buddhist sect) is Sennyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 宗祖 俊芿（しゅんじょう）（月輪大師・かぢりんだいし）
sen.e: The founder of the sect is Shunjo (Kazirin daishi.)
The founder of the sect is Shunjo (Kazirin daishi.)
The founder of the sect is Shunjo (also known as Kazirin daishi.)

sen.j: 真言宗泉涌寺派の歴史は、泉涌寺を密（天台・真言）・禅・律・浄の四宗兼学の道場として、俊芿が中興したことにより始まる。
sen.e: The history of Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school began with that Shunjo made Sennyu-ji as a dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of Shishu or Yonshu kengaku (learning the four sects of Buddhism) i.e. Mitsu (Tendai and Shingon), Zen, Ritsu and Jo and restored the temple.

The history of the Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school began when Shunjo made Sennyu-ji a dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of Shishu or Yonshu kengaku (learning the four sects of Buddhism) i.e. Mitsu (Tendai and Shingon), Zen, Ritsu and Jo and restored the temple.

The history of the Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school began when Shunjo made Sennyu-ji a dojo (place of Buddhist practice or meditation) of Shishu or Yonshu kengaku (learning the four sects of Buddhism) i.e. Mitsu (Tendai and Shingon), Zen, Ritsu and Jo and restored the temple.

sen.j: それ以来、独自の宗風を保ち、また、泉涌寺は皇室の御陵所・香華寺とされて、皇室との関係が深かった。
sen.e: After that, the sect keeps its own unique manner, and was designated as an Imperial mausoleum, Koge-ji temple (general name for temples where ihai (ancestral tablets) is enshrined) and the relation with the Imperial House was deepened.

After that, the sect kept its own unique manner, and was designated as an Imperial mausoleum, Koge-ji temple (general name for temples where ihai or ancestral tablets are enshrined) and relations with the Imperial House was deepened.

After that, the sect kept its own unique manner, and was designated as an Imperial mausoleum, Koge-ji temple (general name for temples where ihai or ancestral tablets are enshrined) and relations with the Imperial House was deepened.

sen.j: 明治時代に入ると、皇室からの保護が無くなり、財政的にも逼迫（ひっぱく）する状態となり衰微した。
sen.e: When the time entered into Meiji era, the protection from the Imperial House was lost and the temple became financially tightened and declined in prosperity.
At the beginning of Meiji era, protection from the Imperial House was lost and the temple became weakened financially and it declined in prosperity.
At the beginning of Meiji period, protection from the Imperial House was lost and the temple became weakened financially and it declined in prosperity.

sen.j: また、政府の宗教政策から、1872年（明治5年）に四宗兼学が廃され、真言宗に属することとなった。
sen.e: Furthermore, with the policies on the religions of the government of the time, Shishu kengaku was abolished and became to belong to Shingon sect.
Furthermore, with government policies concerning religions at the time, Shishu kengaku was abolished and came under the Shingon sect.
Furthermore, with government policies concerning religions at the time, Shishu kengaku was abolished in 1872 and came under the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 東寺の管下に入った時期もあったが、1907年（明治40年）には、真言宗古義八派聯合に際して、そのとき初めて泉涌寺派の派名を公称した。
sen.e: Although in a little while, there was a time when the temple administered by To-ji Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple called firstly the school name of itself as the Sennyu-ji school publicly in 1907 at the time of unification of old schools of Shingon sect.
Although, for a while being administered by To-ji Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple was first publicly called the Sennyu-ji school in 1907 at the time of unification of the old schools of Shingon sect.
Although, for a while being administered by To-ji Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple was first publicly called the Sennyu-ji school in 1907 at the time of unification of the old schools of Shingon sect.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争にともなう政府の宗教政策により、1941年（昭和16年）に古義・新義両派の真言宗各宗派が合同し、大真言宗に統合された。
sen.e: Along with the Government policies on the religions during the Pacific War, both each of the new and old schools of Shingon sect were unified to Daishingon sect (literally, larger Shingon sect) in 1941.

Along with Government policies on religions during the Pacific War, each of the new and old schools of the Shingon sect were unified into the Daishingon sect (literally, a larger Shingon sect) in 1941.

Along with Government policies on religions during the Pacific War, each of the new and old schools of the Shingon sect were unified into the Daishingon sect (literally, a larger Shingon sect) in 1941.

sen.j: 戦後、大真言宗から独立し、1952年（昭和27年）9月30日に真言宗泉涌寺派として宗教法人認証。
sen.e: After the war, the Sennyu-ji school became independent from Daishingon sect, and on September 30, 1952, it got certified as the ecclesiastical corporation Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school.
After the war, the Sennyu-ji school became independent from the Daishingon sect, and on September 30, 1952, it became certified as an ecclesiastical corporation Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school.
After the war, the Sennyu-ji school became independent from the Daishingon sect, and on September 30, 1952, it became certified as an ecclesiastical corporation Shingon sect Sennyu-ji school.
On October 17 in the same year, registration was completed.
On October 17 the same year, registration was completed.
On October 17 the same year, registration was completed.

Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) in random order.

sen.e: The graduates of Shuchiin College are entitled to Gon-sozu and a freshmen of the college are entitled to Gon-risshi.
sen.cmt: 「権僧都」は上記15級の中にないようです。

sen.j: 住職資格 （教師資格を有し、得度、度牒後2年、四度加行・受戒・伝法潅頂修了者）
sen.e: Qualification of a chief priest: The one must hold the qualification of the teacher and have completed tokudo (enter the Buddhist priesthood), and 2 years passed since the one received an official certification, and the one must have finished shidokegyo (four trainings), and received the religious precept and Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master).

Qualification of a chief priest: He must hold the qualifications of a teacher and have completed tokudo (entered the Buddhist priesthood), and 2 years have passed since the he had received an official certification, and he must have finished shidokegyo (four types of training), and received the religious precept and Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master).

Qualification of a chief priest: He must hold the qualifications of a teacher and have completed tokudo (entered the Buddhist priesthood), and 2 years have passed since he had received an official certification, and he must have finished shidokegyo (four types of training), and received the religious precept and Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master)).
